> If you are a time traveler
> 

Unfortunately this technology is not available for arabs or the world itself  :/

Hello

Is it possible to use those mods ?

OPT mod 

B9 Aerospace wing

tweascale mod 

Mark IV system mod

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, gilflo said:
> 
> 
> Hello
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Is it possible to use those mods ?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> OPT mod 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> B9 Aerospace wing
> 
> 
> 
> 
> tweascale mod 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Mark IV system mod
> 

1) Read page 1. It has all the rules you will need.  

2) Xanarri has ended her tenure as administrator for this challenge, and since 1.05 is 2 generations old, I think this challenge is officially dead.

Finally did it! I wasn't ever good at spaceplanes and I haven't played for half a year, but I did it in the end!

I did a single circumnavigation.

Time: 3:55:56, excluding time spent warping through the night

Total time: 7:03:56, including time spent landed.

Basically, I landed to warp through the night, which gave me extra landing, proving my plane is controllable, yet taking some time and slowing me down.  

I believe I would have time around 3:45:00 without landing.

[Album](http://imgur.com/a/2bI2A) (forgot how to add embedd imgur)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-27T17:53:18Z" title="10/27/2016 05:53  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 27, 2016</time> by Nik333**

There is a new competition continuation for KSP 1.2 by another member. This competition can be concluded and locked up.

[Kerbin Circumnavigation 1.2 - Aviator Challenge Continuation](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/150988-kerbin-circumnavigation-12-aviator-challenge-continuation/&do=findComment&comment=2828175)

See you all at the new challenge!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-29T01:44:56Z" title="10/29/2016 01:44  AM" data-short="7 yr">October 29, 2016</time> by GDJ**
I saw the rules but with no engines/ wings and/or autopilot mods, it far less interesting.....at leat we should have a no mod challenge and a mod challenge.
Contact the challenge author and make the suggestion. They may decide to take that up.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, gilflo said:
> 
> 
> I saw the rules but with no engines/ wings and/or autopilot mods, it far less interesting.....at leat we should have a no mod challenge and a mod challenge.
> 

Autopilot mods are allowed, actually.  That's the only way I was able to do a 12x circumnavigation--I launched, got it up to altitude, engaged the autopilot, and went to bed.  Woke up in the morning in time to cut the engine and glide in to a landing.
